solution_line_template: The total pay per employee in a day is {hourly_wage}*{hours_per_day} = $<<{hourly_wage}*{hours_per_day}={daily_pay_per_employee}>>{daily_pay_per_employee}
An employee works for {days_per_week}*{weeks_per_month} = <<{days_per_week}*{weeks_per_month}={days_per_month}>>{days_per_month} days in a month.

The total amount of money paid to each employee monthly is {days_per_month}*{daily_pay_per_employee} = $<<{days_per_month}*{daily_pay_per_employee}={monthly_pay_per_employee}>>{monthly_pay_per_employee}
When the number of employees increased to {initial_employees}+{new_hires} = <<{initial_employees}+{new_hires}={total_employees}>>{total_employees} after the new hires in August.
The company pays a total of {total_employees}*{monthly_pay_per_employee} = $<<{total_employees}*{monthly_pay_per_employee}={total_monthly_pay}>>{total_monthly_pay} per month to its employees
